title: Measurements
content: Unless you are baking, there is no need to fuss over perfect measurements of ingredients. It's easier and more fun to estimate and balance your dishes flavours from there

title: Seasoning
content: Season your food at every stage of the cooking process for better flavor.

title: Mise en Place
content: Prepare all your ingredients before you start cooking. A tidy and organized kitchen makes the process smoother.

title: Boiling Pasta
content: There is no difference in starting pasta in boiling water or room temp water. In fact, the latter is more convenient and the method I adopt. Just make sure to taste the pasta for when its cooked to al dente.

title: Resting
content: The cooking process continues even after the heat is off: Residual heat continues to cook meat even off the pan; Sauces thicken as they coll down. These factors should be taken into consideration to prevent under/overcooking

title: Oil Frying
content: Take note that when food is added to oil, the oil's temperature will drop due to the large difference in temperature. Always let oil get up to the appropriate temperature before cooking. Take cure to not exceed the smoking point, risking scalding your pan and even fires.

title: Kitchen Scraps
content: Vegetable scraps like peels, ends or cores can be used to make a stock. Likewise with the heads or shells of shrimp/prawns. Such 'waste' can also be composted
